contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox gridiron football person |image= |birth_date=November 4, 1904 |birth_place= [[Ahsahka, Idaho]] |death_date={{death date and age|1986|01|21|1904|11|12}} |College=[[Oregon State University|Oregon State]] |Position=[[Center (American football)|Center]]<br>[[Guard (American football)|Guard]] |DraftedYear= |DraftedRound= |Awards= |Honors=[[Oregon Sports Hall of Fame]] (1980)<br>Oregon State University<br> Sports Hall of Fame (1994) |Records= |Retired #s= |years=1929-1936 |teams=[[Chicago Bears]] |Stats=y |DatabaseFootball=CARLSZUC01}} '''Jules Ed "Zuck" Carlson''' (November 12, 1904 â€“ January 21, 1986) was an [[American football]] [[offensive lineman]] who played for the [[Chicago Bears]] from [[1929 NFL season|1929]]-[[1936 NFL season|1936]]. He played in 3 title games, winning the championship twice in [[1932 NFL season|1932]] and [[1933 NFL season|1933]]. Born in Idaho, Carlson grew up in [[The Dalles, Oregon]] and attended [[The Dalles-Wahtonka High School|The Dalles High School]].<ref name=osualum>{{cite web|url=http://www.osualum.com/s/359/index.aspx?sid=359&gid=1&pgid=451|title=Dynamic Duo|last=Edmonston, Jr.|first=George|accessdate=2008-02-11|publisher=Oregon State University Alumni Association}}</ref> He played [[college football]] at [[Oregon State University]]. Along with many of his Chicago Bears teammates, he appeared in the 1934 short film ''[[Pro Football (short)|Pro Football]]''. Following his football career, Carlson lived in Chicago and worked as a [[pipefitter]] instructor until his retirement in 1972.<ref name=osualum/> He died in Chicago in 1986. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{IMDb name|id=0137945|name=Zuck Carlson}} {{1932 Chicago Bears}} {{1933 Chicago Bears}} : {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Carlson, Zuck | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American football player | DATE OF BIRTH =November 12, 1904 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Ahsahka, Idaho]] | DATE OF DEATH =January 21, 1986 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Carlson, Zuck}} [[Category:1904 births]] [[Category:1986 deaths]] [[Category:People from The Dalles, Oregon]] [[Category:American football offensive linemen]] [[Category:Chicago Bears players]] [[Category:Oregon State Beavers football players]] {{offensive-lineman-1900s-stub}}
